Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location!”
Reviews.Author: ekirsty
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, we could walk everywhere. Our room was very basic, but it's a hostel so that's what we expected. Very clean! Could do with a bed spread change/wash for a freshen up but linen and bathrooms were very clean. Not sure it would be good if you had a car, but you don't need a car here! We got airport shuttle, 20 euros total for two of us to front door. We also took city bus tour, there is a stop at the end of our street. Highly recommend! Take a walk to Plaza Mayor for dinner too, we found it by accident but went back each night :-) Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Central location, clean, great value”
Reviews.Author: sunalishine
Reviews.Content: The location of the Hostal was perfect, literally steps from Plaza de l'Opera with lots of shops, bars and restaurants within walking distance. The room was exceptionally clean, towels provided & a hairdryer. The beds were comfortable, and although the room was warm it was fine once we opened the window, air-conditioning was also available. I'd recommend Hostal Las Fuentes to anyone - and don't be put off by "Hostal", in Spain this is simply a 2/3 star hotel. The reception staff don't seem to have much English, which is not a criticism, simply a recommendation that if you have no Spanish, bring a phrase book! Also there is free wifi with details available at reception which is extremely handy!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome little hotel in the heart of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: amtettamanzy
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights in July 12. Place is 3 minutes away from Opera station by foot - very convenient when coming from the airport - and 7 minutes away from Plaza del Sol. Found the staff very helpful since the check-in, didn't have any kind of problems with them. The room was clean, comfortable, but a bit small I must say. Anyhow, this was the only negative thing about the hotel. Air conditioning was working greatly, there was a TV and a mini fridge. A safe was available, but it cost 1 euro each time you open it. Bathroom was also clean, had good lighting and excellent shower. No breakfast at the hotel, but plenty of cafes around offering good food for small money. Sleep quality was awesome! I was afraid that considering the location, there was going to be much noise, but it was increadibly silent at nights. Booked room 8, at the back. Would definitely come back to this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: Cameron S
Reviews.Content: Great hostel, stayed for two nights. Room was absolutely lovely. Hostel is really easy to find, metro to opera, then a five e walk (if that) to the hostel. Situated in a great part of Madrid, near loads of bars and restaurants. Would definitely return!!

Reviews.Title: “The location is what is worth”
Reviews.Author: Camila T
Reviews.Content: The hotel is near the metro Opera, but the room is small an the staff is not very kind. They don`t make an effort to help us. We noticed a missing cracker from our room, so we went to speak to the staff and they did not give a a feedback. I wouldn`t return.

Reviews.Title: “Real Value”
Reviews.Author: LCurrin
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights at this Hostal in Madrid. I agree it was a little difficult to find but the location was great, right off the Plaza Opera. We arrived via the Metro from airport which was very cheap compared to Taxi. Person at airport gave us map and marked the transfers so it was very easy to get to town. Restaurants and shopping all within walking distance. The metro was great. Very clean as compared to Paris metro. The room was fine and bath had shower/tub. Room was cleaned everyday with fresh sheets. Small frig if needed. We had street room and it was noisy but we were not there to sleep in. I would stay there again without question.

Reviews.Title: “Worth looking for”
Reviews.Author: RowerBrisbane
Reviews.Content: The taxi had a little difficulty finding this hostal but it was worth the effort. The signage was not very noticeable but once inside and in the small elevator you soon got to reception. The room though typically small was adequate and the shower and toilet facilities very clean and well equipped. This place is very well positioned to visit the Plazor Mayor, Sol and Opera. Can access the metro in a minute to everywhere you want to go but there are some very interesting narrow streets and squares so close that you wilenjoy yourself in this area. There are some very good eateries and bars in the back streets. Worth discovering them.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable value for money and location!”
Reviews.Author: roadtripping1
Reviews.Content: Just to clarify for those who may not know it, the hostal in Spain is not a youth hostel but a low budget, no frills, small hotel (usually in apartments buildings) that offer rooms with either private or shared bathroom facilities. I have lived in Madrid for over a year and have often looked for accommodation for visiting friend and family so I am pretty familiar with the "hostal scene" of the town. Among all the places I have seen, this is definitely a real find! Location is perfect, right off Calle Arenal: 5 minutes walk from the Opera House and the Royal Palace on one side, and 5 minutes walk from Puerta del Sol on the other side (and 2 metro stops at the same distance!). Beside the quite shabby entrance to the building (which is a constant of Madrid's hostels which seem to never have well groomed entrances!) the hostel was a surprise. After a very quick check in, I was assigned a small (I was alone so it was a single room) but incredibly neat and clean room with a nice window on the street below. The bathroom was once again small but super clean and functional. The rooms was basic but perfectly comfortable and well cared for. They serve no breakfast (as in all the hostals) but right below, on Calle Arenal, there are about 1000 bars and coffee places, including Starbucks. I paid 45 euros per night for a room with private bathroom and I'm sure I'll stay here when I go back next time. I could never find something so cheap and comfy in such a central location! Since it's only a few steps away. if your are coming back from a crazy disco night (Joy is just a few stesp away) stop at the Chocolateria San Gines (Pasadizo San Ginés, 5) and have the best churros con chocolate in town :-)

Reviews.Title: “very good, try it and you`ll see”
Reviews.Author: corinaZ
Reviews.Content: A very good accommodation in the centre of the city that I will recommend without hesitation. There are just some minor drawbacks , that`s why I gave just 4 stars. Some of the previous reviewers made a confusion between Las Fuentes and another Hostel, located at the third floor, in the same building. Las Fuentes is at the first. In order to get here, look on google maps, it is very simple and close to Opera subway station. The rooms are quite ok, maybe the single looks a little bit small, because it has a large queen bed. But the bathroom is larger than I expected. You`ll get everything, from every day cleaning and minibar, to AC, WiFi (perfectly functional when I was there), fresh towels daily, etc. There is also a computer in the hall. Well, try to ring long when you arrive, because sometimes the person from the reception is somewhere in the hostel. The only problems I encountered were: the temperature(either breathtakingly hot, or chilly…and I was there in February..) and the inner noise. About the noise, it is the first time for me when I experience noise done by the staff, speaking loud in Spanish most of the day, sometimes screaming orders and shouting, and always wearing high and very noisy heels. No chance to sleep after 8 AM. Obviously, no nap allowed in the afternoon. A, and no one speaks English, but this is smth we are used to in Spain. Overall, the experience was more than ok and if ever in Madrid, I`ll come back here without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “¡Que bonito!”
Reviews.Author: Gman1976
Reviews.Content: Very pleasantly surprised. Good location. Found it difficult to find, because of over grown trees hiding hotel sign! The reception is also on the 1st floor, which was a bit confusing. Staff are pleasant, but speak minimal English (I suppose that is expected in a none English speaking country!) WiFi works great as I'm writing this review from my bedroom, which is quite far away form the reception. Room is small, but it is the single room. It is well decorated, clean and comfortable. Not much cupboard space (saves me packing my suitcase again when I leave!) For the price and the location, I could not have asked for more. A 2.5 star hotel? Again I have wonder about the UK rating system, because this would be a 3 or 4 star hotel in some places in the UK!

Reviews.Title: “A very cute place and close to everything a tourist would want”
Reviews.Author: AllureSport
Reviews.Content: We (2 females) stayed at this place in October 2011 and it was the best decision that we made. We arrived couple of hours before check-in time and had to wait an hour to get our room which was fine. The hotel staff spoke minimal English which was not a big issue because they were very pleasant. The hotel has very small elevator, so when you arrive with your luggage, you can put your luggage in the elevator and send it to 2nd floor which is where the reception area is while you can walk up the stairs. Room was very clean and decorated nicely. Only thing lacking is not sufficient hot water. Location is unbeatable, very very close to everything. We felt safe there. You can't go wrong by choosing this place during your stay in madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a place to sleep”
Reviews.Author: Bav20
Reviews.Content: My first stay in a hostel. My room was smaller than others described in these reviews, but adequate as I wasn't planning on spending a lot of time there. No fridge, but safe that you pay 1 Euro each time you use it. The woman at the front desk didn't speak english but we were able to communicate by my very minimal spanish and her gestures. It overlooked the courtyard so there was no noise coming from the streets, despite that there is a dance club around the corner. However, there is no sound proofing within the hostel. It was as if my door was open. I was the room farthest away from the front desk, but heard every conversation there. The rooms next to me as well as mine do not close quietly due to the door frame being slightly smaller than the door, so it can only slam close. Small stand-up shower. My room was clean. I've seen other hostels in the area but don't know how they compare. Great central location, can walk almost anywhere and is steps to the metro if needed to go farther.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel close to Plaza Major”
Reviews.Author: MarlinPrice
Reviews.Content: We are staying here tonight (9-19-2911) and it is a great little hotel. It is about 200 meters or so from the Opera metro stop. We flew into Madrid and took three metro trains to get to the Opera stop. The hotel check in in on the 1st floor landing (you come in on the 0th floor(?). The door is labeled "CH" for some reason. Anyway, there is a lift although you can only get one person and luggage in at a time -quite amazing actually. The rooms are very small but very clean and plenty of hot water. Everything just sparkles. They have a coffee vending machine in the hallway. They have all the lights on motion detectors to conserve energy so you are walking down the hall and the list come on as you walk. Air conditioner works great. The hotel is about three blocks from Plaza Major and the Mercado de San Miguel. Got to hit that place for lunch! And a couple of great restaurants right next door. Perfect place for exploring downtown Madrid! Pre-booked on Internet for 53euros for the night.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hostal - would definitely recommend!”
Reviews.Author: chocolate27
Reviews.Content: My first experience of staying in a 'hostal' in Spain and would thoroughly recommend this one - not sure what people were expecting in some of the more negative reviews I read on here - I paid £33 a night so it's never going to be the ritz but good points: Location - excellent, 30 seconds from opera metro station - if you follow the instructions on the hostal website no reason at all why you wouldn't find it. So close to local bars, shops, cash machine, sights, etc. Cleanliness - the place was spotless, cleaned every day, clean towels,etc. Friendliness - on check in, owner spoke excellent English, showed me to my room and how to use key card to get into the hostal - all other staff I met were very polite and friendly. Yes, the room was small but had everything you needed, wardrobe, small fridge, bedside cabinet, lovely big shower, television, safe - true if you had a massive suitcase you would struggle to find place for it but I didn't have that problem. There was a computer to use in the lobby - free of charge I think, 2 drinks machines plus some sofas and chairs/tables in the communal areas which might be handy if travelling in a group. All in all a great place to stay for a few nights in Madrid - would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: IvanvA
Reviews.Content: Our first meeting with s Spanish hostal was a good one. Hostal Las Fuentes offers good clean and affordable accommodation in the centre of Madrid. Aircon (much needed in the summer) was working great and the room was equipped with Flat screen TV, nice bathroom (a little small but with a tub), WIFI/public PC, minibar and a bed suitable for two not too big people. The hostal is however rather hard to find as no signs are posted and the Hostal is situated at 1-2 floor in a building that looks like a residential building with shops at street level. The entrance is a large brown wooden door (No. 10). At the left is series of door bells (apparently several Hostals are situated in the building). Hit the button that says "Las Fuentes" and the door can be opened. Take the stairs (a very small elevator is also available) and go to 1st floor. The chances are that the reception staff does only speak very little English. But the reception clerk was very nice and even showed us to our room and our stay worked out fine. Notice. Parking in central Madrid is as in most European capitals rather expensive. If you park for several days - look around - many parking buildings are available in the area and prices varies a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Good clean no-frills budget hostal in central Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Williamek
Reviews.Content: This hostal is not really a purpose-built hotel but several large apartments divided into a number of small rooms (a common thing in Spain I believe), split over 2 floors. It's budget/economy, no frills accommodation but the location is great: right between Plaza Mayor and Opera, in the middle of the touristy area of Madrid. If you want to be very central on low budget this is a great place, if you want more comfort you're better of elsewhere. We stayed here for almost a week during the heat wave in Madrid (temperatures around 35 degrees all day long). Our first room was bad: overlooking a busy street so couldn't open the windows because of the noise all night long, and airco emitted some foul smell so couldn't use it. Slept very badly that night and asked to change a room next morning. Second room was better, overlooking a small courtyard so could keep the window open. But because of the heat in Madrid it was still very hot in the nights and I slept badly for the entire week. Had we come here at a different time of the year this probably wouldn't have been a problem though. Rooms are small and a little cramped. Bed is ok but pillows very uncomfortable, bathroom challenging (tiny shower with no enclosure), but it's all clean and I'd rank it "average" to "good" for a budget hostel. WiFi is free. Service is a concierge who is very helpful but speaks almost no English. There's no restaurant or breakfast. No parking. Note that hostal is not easy to find because no signs, just look for a gate at #10 and press a special buzzer with hotel's name written on it, then walk up the staircase to 1st floor where the reception is.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good price, check your credit card bill carefully”
Reviews.Author: ALY2011WI
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel based on location, price, and reviews on TripAdvisor. The location is great, just a few minutes walking to the Puerta Del Sol metro station and the price is great for what you get. I was worried about the thin walls (which seem to be a problem in most hotels in Spain, according to reviews), but I didn't hear my neighbors (maybe I was too tired, maybe they were quiet) and I didn't hear the street as my room faced inside (towards a small "courtyard"). I initially had a problem with them, but it was resolved in a few days. The problem was that my credit card was charged for all the days of my stay right away, instead of the 1 day deposit as stated on the website and on the receipt. I initially received a rather rude reply (stating that they don't take credit cards and couldn't possibly have charged my card), but after I sent them a copy of my receipt, I got a refund for the other days and a polite note saying there was a problem with the website. The staff does speak English which is important to me, but the man who is there during the day speaks English poorly and was rather surly and seemed to be in a rush, making it seem like I was in his way or disrupting his day or somehow inconveniencing him. The lady who works the evening/night shift speaks much better English and was very polite and answered all my questions. The room itself was tiny, about the size of the bed plus 3 feet, just enough to walk between the bed and the bathroom door. This is also the hotel with the "world's smallest elevator"; it's about the width of my carry-on suitcase. I might stay here again since the location is so good and the price is decent.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value hotel”
Reviews.Author: holiholiEssex
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights on a city break and had a fantastic time. This hostel is more like a hotel with the rooms cleaned daily and towels changed everyday as well. The location is ideal, within walking distance of the underground and shops, restaurants etc. We walked evrywhere on the tourist map and seen much more than when on the city tour bus. There is a lovely cafe serving value for money breakfasts very close by. The only downside of our trip was being pickpocketed on the tube travelling from the airport to the hostel. As for internet access we had no problem using the wireless in our room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location. Basic. Clean room and bathroom”
Reviews.Author: Mechii
Reviews.Content: Rooms are small but have bathroom, tv and minibar as well as air conditioning. They are clean and tidy. When i stayed at the hostal the light of my hallway wasn't working so it was dark. There is free wifi access and if you don't have a netbook, there is a computer you may use. The service is good. It has no breakfast but there are nice coffee shops one block away. I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but very difficult to find if you don't know Spanish.”
Reviews.Author: HarshwardhanGupta
Reviews.Content: The room was nice, though very small. The bathroom was clean and functional. The English-speaking staff, when on duty, was very helpful. The Spanish speaking staff was impossible to communicate with. The hotel was next to impossible to find. The building entrance had no nameplate. Even when I entered the building, there were no directions. The address of the hotel as in Booking.com was complete but in Spanish, so I was lost for a long time, with luggage. Even the hotel's main door did not have any sign. For its facilities, the price was too high. And some of the automatic lights in the corridors did not work, making walking in the hotel very dangerous due to numerous small unexpected steps. The wi-fi worked perfectly!

Reviews.Title: “As good as I remembered”
Reviews.Author: majesty318
Reviews.Content: I used to stay at Las Fuentes all the time when I was a student traveling through Madrid. Since my friends and I were on a budget even ten years later, I chose it again - and it was exactly as I remembered. It still looks new and is spotlessly clean. There is a computer in the lobby with free internet access. We stayed in a triple which is definitely cozy - the three beds were touching, and there was not much room to move around or to store our luggage. However, these are small issues for the bargain price. The location can't be beat. I love staying in the Opera/ Sol area because it's just so easy to get around!

Reviews.Title: “eccellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: antonioVerona
Reviews.Content: we have past a few days in this wonderful hotel, is little but very clean and pratically in the heart of Madrid. You have a card for to open the doors so you can come back at any time of the day or of the night. PC whit internet are available and in the room there is a LCD television. The room are very clean and with a windows on a small road weew the traffic is limited. No breakfast but I think is 'nt a problem the first bar solve your hungry problem. I suggest this good hotel also for the price very low and for the location . You can be in the most important squares or street of Madrid in a few minutes. Very good hotel in our future travel to madrid surely i will go there. Thank you to mr Thomas Antonio e Gabriella Lanza 6- 7- 8 marzo 2011

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Elenka19
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights. The location is excellent! The room was pretty clean, the hotel staff was also very nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: postikortti
Reviews.Content: This hostel is in an excellent location right in the city center very close to Ópera metro station. The double room was small, but impeccably clean with a private bathroom. The first night the room was very cold even with an extra blanket. For the second night we asked for radiators to be turned up (or more precisely on) and it was very nice. The third night the radiators were working in the evening, but someone turned the heat off in the middle of the night, so the room was very cold again in the morning. Also the walls are paper thin, so if your neighbors are noisy, you can hear everything. The rooms were cleaned every day and the hostel provided clean towels. The staff was very friendly even though they didn't speak great English. This hostel doesn't serve breakfast, but there are plenty of places to eat nearby. Despite the issues with the room temperature we had a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “You can't image a hostel can be better than an hotel”
Reviews.Author: lead_expression
Reviews.Content: Beautiful and clean room, 20m from Calle del Arenal, between Opera and Puerta del Sol... In one word, more than perfect location! The price is ridicolous comparing to the quality of staying. No breakfast, of course, but a good bar in front of. Located in a little street (then not so noisy) but next to the most beautifil street in Madrid. A few tens of meters from the underground (this is a bless, when you're coming from the aeroport) and from one of the best plaza in Madrid where you can find a lot of restaurants and bars. Fantastic the air conditioning (without it you can't survive in the summer...) and the freege, thanks to which we used to have breakfast in our room. There's also a common place if you don't want to stay in your room. There are only two (little) cons: first of all, the owner almost doesn't speak english (but kindly tries to do the best she can to help you) and there is no lift, that can be a problem if you have very heavy luggage. In summary, I can strongly recommend this hostel.

Reviews.Title: “You must stay here!”
Reviews.Author: mlm24
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights here and loved it. The room is bright and clean, free internet, and a perfect location. Staff is nice and helpful. For excellent tacos, try the taco stand "Mi Ciudad" across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Good hostal for price and location”
Reviews.Author: willemsk
Reviews.Content: Hostal is in a great location - easy to walk to everything. Hostal itself was very clean and was good for a couple nights' stay. We had one problem with our door where it wouldn't lock behind us, but we were able to get that resolved.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location for seeing Madrid”
Reviews.Author: DeeKe
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our long-weekend stay in this place. It's not at all like a hostel. Really, it's more like a hotel. We had a double room (with a proper double bed, not two singles pushed together!) with a spotlessly clean en suite. Towels and bedding are changed every day. I suppose you could say the room was a little small but with such a fantastically central location there's no way you'd be spending much time in it! All the major tourist attractions are within easy walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and bright, central location, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: WhycantIbemyself
Reviews.Content: I was bounced to here when the Hostal Oriente overbooked me, but I'm glad I stayed. It's small (one floor in an apartment block) with few facilities. It's not easy to find (look for the door to number 10, press the Fuentes buzzer, then use the minute lift or walk up to the 1st floor and it's the door on the right). However, my room was modern, clean, bright and cheerful, if not exactly large. Staff were helpful, and all spoke some English. I couldn't get the free WiFi to work with my laptop, but they had two internet conected PC's available free for guests to use. No food in the hostal, but plenty of places to eat nearby. Other reviews have complained of noise but I had no problem (I guess it depends on your neighbours). Excellent value for somewhere in the heart of a capital city.

Reviews.Title: “Simple, Clean, Good Location, Free WiFi”
Reviews.Author: ffmdave
Reviews.Content: Simple place to stay while in Madrid. No breakfast, but the area is crowded with small cafes and there's a 24 hour a day convenience down the street. For €45 a night, in a capital city, you get a safe, clean place to stay, it's basic, but good basic. The staff is very friendly, but English is limited, so have a few Spanish phrases ready to go. Hotel is located near the Opera and Sol metro stops.

Reviews.Title: “noisy hostal”
Reviews.Author: svharkes
Reviews.Content: Its the most noisy place I have ever stayed, do not stay there if you want to sleep!! paperthin walls, alarm on the doors, and that the doors have to be slamd to cloose. Also they try to kick you out of the rooms ca 10 in the morning for cleaning, start phoning ca 0900! No turist imformation, bad english. If people talk in the hallway up to the rooms, it sounds like they are in your room talking. but they have clean rooms, good location, free computer that they did forget to inform about!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice small hotel”
Reviews.Author: englishinscotland
Reviews.Content: We were a large group all staying in this hotel/hostel and were very impressed. It's very well turned-out, very clean, and the staff were friendly. The location's great if you're a tourist - 2 mins walk to the Plaza Mayor and the Palace and a stone's throw from the Opera metro station. I'd recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “OK - not great”
Reviews.Author: TOSD
Reviews.Content: This Hostal is in a very good location just around the corner from the Plaza Mayor. The room was very clean and tidy. We were disappointed though as there was no hot water. As well, when we called the hostal to get direction no one spoke English (fair enought) but when we arrived, the same person spoke perfect English (!) If you are going to stay, remember that there is no parking on the premises, but within walking distance.

HotelInfo.Name: Hostal Las Fuentes
HotelInfo.Address: C/ Las Fuentes 10, 1-D | Plaza de la Opera, 28013 Madrid, Spain
